citation.article-title: Lactobacillus arizonensis sp. nov., isolated from jojoba meal.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus arizonensis sp. nov.
Lactobacillus arizonensis (ar.i.zon'en.sis. L. gen. n. arizonensis named after the state in the United States where it was isolated)
Cells are rods, 1x4.0-5.0 μm in size, which occur singly and in short chains.
Colonies on agar are white, convex, smooth, circular and opaque.
In broth, growth causes turbidity which clears after a few days due to settling of cells.
Acid is produced from cellobiose, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, lactose, maltose, D-mannitol, D-mannose, melibiose, raffinose, D-ribose, salicin, D-sorbitol, sucrose and trehalose.
Some strains may ferment L-(-)-arabinose and rhamnose, but D-xylose is not fermented.No gas is produced from D-glucose.
L-(+­)- and D-(-)-lactic acids are the only organic acids produced.
Temperature relations are as follows: optimum, 35-40 °C; minimum, 10-15 °C; maximum, 45-50 °C.
The type strain is NRRL B-14768T (=DSM 13273T).
